channel.title: [Project Czar] Disabling magic on NPCs with 0 HP
channel.description:
This should be really easy for all of you. This was tested with Project Czar. Warning: Your NPCs will no longer attack back if you do this tutorial; Will find a fix. ---
Go into your [tt]NPCHandler class[/tt] and search for
[code]HP <= 0[/code]
You should see this (if you're using the correct base that this tutorial is directed at)
[code]if (HP <= 0) { // This will cause client crashes if we don't use this :) - xero HP = 3000; }[/code]
Now, we need to make it so the NPC's HP is no longer 3000, so we need to remove this if statement. To remove it correctly, select from the closing brace ([tt]}[/tt]) to the word "if" and press backspace. Now, save and go into your client class.
Go to packet 131.
Now for the actual listening part.
So, we will need an if-statement to start.
Take this for example:
[code]if (HP == 0) { sendMessage("You cannot attack this NPC!"); }[/code]
If you were to compile, you would get an error saying that it cannot find the variable 'HP'. So, we will need to specify which class file the variable is in. In this case, it is our NPCHandler class.
So, we would need to change our if-statement to
[code]if (server.npcHandler.npcs[npcIndex].HP == 0) {[/code]
But now, if you notice, you get no compiling errors, but your client will crash. So we will need to add a return statement into the if-statement.
[code]return;[/code]
Now, we will need to add [tt]teleportToX[/tt] and [tt]teleportToY[/tt] so our characters don't initalize combat with the NPC, so include this in your if-statement
[code]teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY;[/code]
This teleports your character to where he's standing, so he does not run up to the NPC and initalize combat with him/her.
Now, put this into your if-statement
[code]server.npcHandler.npcs[npcIndex].IsUnderAttack = false;[/code]
That makes it so your character doesn't engage in combat with the NPC, therefore he wont follow or attack you.
(Make sure you put everything above the [tt]return[/tt] statement.)
And there you go how easy was that?

item.title: [Project Czar] Disabling magic on NPCs with 0 HP
item.dc:creator: @faded_vision Faded Vision
item.description:
@faded_vision wrote:

Packet 131 is magic on npcs.

if (npcTargetHealth < 1) { break; }

if (server.npcHandler.npcs[npcIndex].HP == 0) { server.npcHandler.npcs[npcIndex].IsUnderAttack = false; teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; sendMessage("You cannot attack this NPC!"); return; }

        if (server.npcHandler.npcs[npcIndex].HP == 0) {
        server.npcHandler.npcs[npcIndex].IsUnderAttack = false;
        teleportToX = absX;
        teleportToY = absY;
    sendMessage("You cannot attack this NPC!");
        return;

and i got this 2 errors

client.java:20137: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable npcIndex
location: class client
if (server.npcHandler.npcs[npcIndex].HP == 0) {
^

symbol : variable npcIndex
location: class client

^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
2 errors
Finished!
Press any key to continue . . .

@kihomura wrote:

There’s no need for that second if-statement and the return statement should be inside the if-statement and so should

server.npcHandler.npcs[npcIndex].IsUnderAttack = false;

item.title: [Project Czar] Disabling magic on NPCs with 0 HP
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

The tutorial has been updated.

Before, your character didn’t cast the magic on the NPC, yet the NPC was still initializing combat with the player. But now, neither the NPC or player initialize in combat.
